snippet: Two assaults left 11 officers in southern Afghanistan dead as the authorities were still grappling with the assassination of a top American general.
abstract: Two attacks by Afghan police officers who were collaborating with Taliban claim lives of 11 police officers in southern Afghanistan.

byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Two assaults left 11 officers in southern Afghanistan dead as the authorities were still grappling with the assassination of a top American general.

headline.main: Afghan Officers, Said to Be Working for Taliban, Kill 11 of Their Police Colleagues
headline.print_headline: Afghan Officers, Said to Be Working for Taliban, Kill 11 of Their Police Colleagues
